data.fullContent: Lola signed up for a marathon to raise money for a charity. She had never run more than a mile and knew that running a full marathon was a long shot. She began training, but she found it hard to work out because of her hectic schedule. She ran whenever she could, usually for ten minutes at a time. She tried to make running part of her daily routine and gradually was able to run longer and longer. After months of training, she was finally able to run for three hours without having to stop to catch her breath. She was ready for the race. Though she was exhausted at the end, she made it through the entire marathon.

q1.translation: 萝拉报名参加了一场马拉松，为慈善机构筹款。她从来没有跑过超过一英里的距离，她知道跑完全程马拉松是不可能的。她开始训练，但她发现很难锻炼，因为她的日程很忙。她一有机会就跑，通常一次跑十分钟。她试着让跑步成为她日常生活的一部分，渐渐地，她能够跑得越来越长。经过几个月的训练，她终于能够连续跑三个小时而不用停下来喘口气。
q1.front: Lola signed up for a marathon to raise money for a charity. She had never run more than a mile and knew that running a full marathon was a long shot. She began training, but she found it hard to work out because of her hectic schedule. She ran whenever she could, usually for ten minutes at a time. She tried to make running part of her daily routine and gradually was able to run longer and longer. After months of training, she was finally able to run for three hours without having to stop to catch her breath.

options.sentence: Lola's friends were determined to cheer her on as she ran and wanted to help her in any way they could.
Lola trained whenever she could and was eventually able to run for a longer time.
Lola decided to quit running and enjoy her life in the small town where she lived.
Lola wasn't able to finish the race in time, but she was still proud of herself for the hard work she put into training for it.
